meta.sourceOfficial: Directorate General of Immigration & Passports (DGIP), Government of Pakistan
notes: Includes updated document requirements and policy guidelines per DGIP official site.
Includes online & offline service options, police reports for lost passports, 24/7 offices availability.
Fee tables (MRP & ePassport) should be kept up to date annually with DGIP notifications.

ordinaryMRP.description: Standard passport issued to Pakistani citizens for international travel.
ordinaryMRP.policy: Every citizen of Pakistan is entitled to a Machine Readable Passport upon completion of required formalities (Passport Act 1974 & Passport Rules).

ePassport.description: Enhanced passport with biometric chip for faster clearance; available nationwide.
notes: Photo name fields have character limits.
Fast Track service is not available for ePassport delivery per DGIP.
e-Passport issuance is available from all field offices.

official.description: Issued to government officials on official assignments.
official.deliveryTime: Approximately 4 working days once documents are complete.

sections.title: Understanding Pakistani Passport
sections.description: Learn about the types of passports and why you need one.

content.heading: What is a Pakistani Passport?
content.text: A Pakistani passport is an official travel document issued for international travel that also proves Pakistani citizenship and identity.

content.heading: When is it required?
content.text: Required for all international travel; most countries require at least 6 months validity on your passport beyond your planned stay.

content.heading: Types of Passports
content.text:
• Ordinary MRP
• e-Passport (biometric)
• Official or Diplomatic (government personnel)

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria
sections.description: Check if you qualify to apply for a Pakistani passport.

content.heading: Who Can Apply?
content.text: Every Pakistani citizen including newborns. No minimum age.

content.heading: Special Eligibility Notes
content.text: Dual nationals must show their foreign passport with photocopy. NOC is required for government employees. Minors need both parents' IDs or legal guardianship documents.

content.heading: Adults (New | Renewal | Change)
content.text:
• Proof of fee payment (challan/eReceipt with PSID)
• Original CNIC/NICOP + copy
• Previous passport + copy (if renewing)
• NOC (if government employee)
• Foreign passport + copy for Dual Nationals

content.heading: Minors
content.text:
• Original CRC / FRC (age-appropriate type) + copy
• Parents' CNICs + copies
• Guardianship Court order (if applicable)
• Death certificate if a parent is deceased

content.heading: Lost Passport Case
content.text: • Police FIR / report mentioning previous passport number

content.heading: Damaged Case
content.text:
• Original damaged passport
• Police FIR (if theft/third party damage)
• Affidavit on stamp paper

content.heading: Hybrid Process (Office)
content.text: Pay fee online or via app, book appointment (optional), visit RPO/EPO for live biometrics, photo, interview and submission.

content.heading: Full Online Process (Renewal Only)
content.text: Available for eligible renewals. Pay fee and upload photo & fingerprints online; passport delivered to your address.

content.heading: Standard In-Person Visit
content.text: Visit RPO/EPO, submit docs, biometric capture, interview and follow official steps.

content.heading: Online Delivery
content.text: Delivery via courier typically adds 2–3 additional days.

content.heading: Pro Tips
content.text: Renew 7–12 months before expiry. Use official DGIP portals/apps only. Keep CNIC valid and complete all documents.

content.heading: Warnings
content.text: Incorrect/incomplete documents cause rejections. Protect tracking IDs and personal information.

whats_this.heading: Passport Immigration Wizard
whats_this.description: The Pakistani Passport is an official travel document issued by the Directorate General of Immigration & Passports (DGIP). It is required for all international travel and serves as proof of Pakistani citizenship. This wizard guides you through the application process step by step.
how_we_help: Step-by-step guidance tailored to your passport application type
Fee calculator for MRP and ePassport options
Personalized roadmap with realistic time estimates
Office finder with RPO/EPO locations and timings
quick_instructions: Select your passport application type (New, Renewal, or Lost/Damaged)
Provide location details to find your nearest passport office
Receive a custom roadmap and document checklist
Validate your passport application against requirements
whats_this.disclaimer: This wizard provides general guidance based on publicly available DGIP information and should not be considered legal advice. Requirements may vary and can change. Always verify current procedures with your local RPO/EPO office.

document_need.title: What brings you here?
document_need.description: Select your passport application type so we can provide the most relevant guidance.

options.title: New Passport
options.description: First-time passport application or expired passport

options.title: Renewal
options.description: Renew your existing valid or recently expired passport

options.title: Lost / Damaged
options.description: Replace a lost, stolen, or damaged passport

location.title: Location Information
location.description: Your nearest Regional Passport Office (RPO) is determined by your current location.
location.country_note: This wizard is specifically for Pakistani passport applications.
location.location_note: Why location matters: While you can apply at any passport office regardless of your CNIC address per DGIP policy, knowing your location helps us find the nearest RPO/EPO for convenience. Some offices offer 24/7 services.

phases.title: Pay Fee & Gather Docs
phases.description: Pay the passport fee online via 1Link/bank challan and collect all required documents including CNIC, photos, and previous passport.

phases.title: Visit RPO/EPO
phases.description: Visit your nearest Regional Passport Office or Executive Passport Office. Submit documents, complete biometric capture (fingerprints, photo), and attend interview.

phases.title: Processing
phases.description: Your application is processed by DGIP. Normal processing takes ~10 working days, Urgent ~4 days, Fast Track ~2 days.

phases.title: Collect Passport
phases.description: Collect your passport from the office or receive it via courier delivery if you opted for online/delivery service.

documents_checklist.label: Fee Payment Receipt (Challan/eReceipt)
documents_checklist.description: Proof of fee payment with PSID via bank, 1Link, or online

documents_checklist.label: Original CNIC / NICOP
documents_checklist.description: Valid 13-digit CNIC or NICOP with photocopy

documents_checklist.label: Previous Passport (if any)
documents_checklist.description: Original previous passport with photocopy for renewal or re-issuance

documents_checklist.label: CRC / FRC for Minors
documents_checklist.description: Child Registration Certificate or FRC for applicants under 18

documents_checklist.label: Parents' CNICs (for minors)
documents_checklist.description: Original CNICs of both parents with photocopies

documents_checklist.label: NOC (Government Employees)
documents_checklist.description: No Objection Certificate from employer if government/semi-government employee

documents_checklist.label: Police FIR (Lost/Stolen)
documents_checklist.description: FIR mentioning previous passport number for lost/stolen cases

documents_checklist.label: Foreign Passport (Dual Nationals)
documents_checklist.description: Original foreign passport with photocopy for dual nationality holders

validation.title: Passport Application Validation
validation.description: Ensure your passport application meets all requirements before submission

upload_section.title: Upload Application Documents
upload_section.description: Upload your completed application form and supporting documents to Document Vault

items.label: Full name matches CNIC exactly (no abbreviations)
Date of birth matches CNIC records
Father's name and husband's name (if applicable) are correct
CNIC number is valid and not expired
Fee receipt/challan with correct PSID is attached
Fee amount matches selected passport type and pages
Previous passport original + photocopy included (if renewal)
Recent passport-size photo meets DGIP specifications
Photo has white background, no glasses, face clearly visible
Fingerprints are clear and not damaged (avoid henna/injuries)
Minor applicant has both parents' CNICs ready
Dual nationality holder has foreign passport copy
Damaged passport original brought for inspection
Affidavit on stamp paper ready (if applicable)

tips: New passport applications require visiting an RPO/EPO in person for biometrics.
Renewals can be done fully online if you meet the eligibility criteria.
For lost passports, file a police FIR immediately — you'll need it for re-issuance.
Check if ePassport is available at your chosen office for faster international clearance.
pitfalls: Don't apply with an expired CNIC — renew your CNIC first.
Government employees applying without NOC will have their application rejected.
Don't apply online for a new passport — in-person biometrics are mandatory for first-time applicants.

tips: You can apply at any passport office regardless of your CNIC address per DGIP policy.
Many RPOs now operate 24/7 in three shifts — check before visiting.
Urban centers have Executive Passport Offices (EPOs) with premium, less-crowded service.
pitfalls: Don't assume all offices offer ePassport — verify before visiting.
Avoid visiting on Fridays after 12:30 PM as most offices close early.
24/7 offices may have limited services during night shifts.

tips: Pay your fee online before visiting — it saves time at the office.
Bring original documents AND photocopies of everything.
Book an appointment via DGIP website if available in your area.
Morning visits (before 10 AM) typically have shorter wait times.
pitfalls: Don't visit without fee payment proof — you cannot submit without it.
Incomplete documents will result in rejection and a wasted trip.
Fast Track service is NOT available for ePassport delivery.
Don't use unofficial agents — only apply through official DGIP channels.

tips: Confirm office hours before visiting — 24/7 offices operate in shifts.
EPOs offer premium service with less crowding but same fees.
Bring all documents in a clear folder for faster processing.
Some offices accept online token bookings — check DGIP website.
pitfalls: Don't rely on unofficial office listings — verify on DGIP website.
Avoid peak hours (10 AM - 1 PM) for shorter wait times.
Some remote area offices may have limited service days.
Don't bring expired documents — all IDs must be currently valid.

tips: Double-check your name spelling matches your CNIC exactly — mismatches cause delays.
Verify fee amount matches your selected passport type (MRP vs ePassport) and page count.
Keep your tracking ID safe — you'll need it to check application status.
For travel, ensure passport validity is at least 6 months beyond your travel date.
pitfalls: Don't submit with name mismatches between CNIC and application — it will be rejected.
Avoid submitting blurry or non-compliant photos — they must meet DGIP specifications.
Don't forget to cancel old passport if applying for re-issuance due to loss.
Incorrect fee payment (wrong amount or wrong category) will delay processing.
